definition: to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent

sentences.english: Maintenance of the patient's circulating fluid volume is the central feature of DHF care.
sentences.chinese: 登革出血热医护的核心特点是要维持患者的循环液量。

sentences.english: Other haemorrhagic fevers were excluded by specific tests.
sentences.chinese: 经检测已排除了其他出血热疾病的可能。

sentences.english: Hemorrhagic fever caused by the virus is hantavirus.
sentences.chinese: 引起出血热的病毒是汉坦病毒。

sentences.english: He died of Marburg haemorrhagic fever four days after hospital admission.
sentences.chinese: 他在住院4天后死于马尔堡出血热。

sentences.english: It causes Marburg haemorrhagic fever, which is often fatal.
sentences.chinese: 其导致马尔堡出血热，往往是致命的。

sentences.english: Cases are generally non-lethal but dengue occasionally results in a deadly hemorrhagic fever.
sentences.chinese: 一般不会致死但是偶尔会引起致命的出血热。

definition: hand foot and mouth disease, HFMD, caused by a number of intestinal viruses, usually affecting young children
epidemic encephalitis B (abbr. for 乙型腦炎|乙型脑炎[yi3 xing2 nao3 yan2])
epidemic encephalitis B, aka Japanese encephalitis
